prompt:
Describe the spatial relationships in this diagram.

CONTAINMENT: Which text labels are inside or outside each closed curve?
CONNECTIONS: Which text labels are connected by lines? Note any branching or unconnected lines.
BOUNDARY CROSSINGS: Do any lines cross the boundaries of closed curves?
NESTING: Are any closed curves nested inside others?

Do not interpret meaning. Only describe what you see spatially.
evaluation:
# Spatial Relationships in the Diagram

## CONTAINMENT:

**Top oval (circled):**
- Contains the text "wounded"

**Middle rounded rectangle:**
- Contains the text "disgraced"

**Bottom rounded shape:**
- Contains the text "wounded"

**Outside all closed curves:**
- The word "man" appears three times as separate labels outside the closed shapes

## CONNECTIONS:

- A horizontal line connects from "man" (left) to the top oval containing "wounded"
- A horizontal line connects from "man" (left) to the middle shape containing "disgraced"
- A curved/angled line connects from "man" (left) to the bottom shape containing "wounded"
- All three "man" labels on the left appear to originate from approximately the same vertical area
- No branching structures are evident; each line goes from a "man" label to one closed shape

## BOUNDARY CROSSINGS:

- The lines connecting "man" labels to the closed curves cross into/terminate at the boundaries of their respective shapes
- No lines pass completely through a shape and exit the other side

## NESTING:

- No closed curves are nested inside other closed curves
- All three closed shapes are separate and non-overlapping
